headline: Major sports TV network shutting down, leaving fans scrambling
summary: I have cable only because we share the household with my in-laws, and it is a solid package that also includes internet services. However, we never connected the cable to our TV upstairs. Why? We didn’t need it to, since we use Netflix, YouTube, and other platforms to access the content we ...

headline: Netflix Co-CEO Ted Sarandos Defends Warner Bros. Discovery Deal, Says YouTube Is More Than 'Cat Videos' — Ross Gerber Agrees
summary: On Tuesday, Netflix Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) co-CEO Ted Sarandos argued before U.S. senators that YouTube has become television in every meaningful sense, a defense of the company's Warner Bros. Discovery (NASDAQ:WBD) acquisition. headline: Trump Says He ‘Shouldn’t Be Involved’ in Warner Bros. Deal
summary: President Trump said he will leave decisions about Netflix’s proposed acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery’s movie and TV production studios and HBO Max streaming service to the Justice Department, a reversal from prior comments about his role in the review process.  “I haven’t been involved,” Trump said in an interview with NBC News’s Tom Llamas, released late Wednesday.

headline: Former NBC Cable President Tom Rogers on Netflix-WBD deal scrutiny, Disney leadership changes
summary: Tom Rogers, former NBC Cable president and Versant senior advisor, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss news of President Trump telling NBC News he won't get involved in the battle between Netflix and Paramount Skydance to buy Warner Bros. Discovery, Disney's leadership reset, and more.

headline: Netflix, Inc. (NFLX): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on Netflix, Inc. on Quality Value Investing’s Substack by David J. Waldron. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on NFLX. Netflix, Inc.’s share was trading at $79.94 as of February 3rd. NFLX’s trailing and forward P/E were 33.00 and 26.45 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. Netflix, Inc. provides entertainment services worldwide. NFLX is transitioning from a pure growth story into a mature global media platform, and the market narrative […]

headline: Is Netflix (NFLX) Now Fairly Priced After Recent Share Price Weakness
summary: If you have been wondering whether Netflix is still worth its current price, this article will walk through what that number might really imply for you as a shareholder or potential investor. The stock recently closed at US$80.16, with a 5.3% decline over 7 days, a 12.4% decline over 30 days, an 11.9% decline year to date, a 20.7% decline over 1 year, 118.5% over 3 years, and 42.2% over 5 years. These figures may change how you think about both its growth story and its risks. Recent coverage...

headline: Trump says he will stay out of Netflix-Paramount fight over Warner Bros
